p:
Enterovirus A71 (EV‐A71) causes hand, foot and mouth disease in young children. AZM and spiramycin (another macrolide) provided significant in vivo protection against EV‐A71 infection in mice.
13 Spiramycin impaired EV‐A71 viral RNA synthesis, and it is likely spiramycin and AZM work through a common mechanism, after viral entry, impairing viral RNA synthesis either directly or indirectly.
